Context:
Michael Herrera joined George Brown College in 2019 as Chief Financial Officer. He provides comprehensive financial leadership and technical expertise for the college. As CFO, he is responsible for college-wide expenditure management and resource allocation, including the management of college funds, financial analysis, reporting and auditing requirements, and the creation of a long-term capital plan for the college. In 2023, Michael took on additional leadership responsibilities associated with Strategic Planning and Institutional Analysis as Senior Vice-President, Institutional Planning.

Michael has spent a career in the not-for-profit sector, having worked with social services, religious, and arts organizations. Prior to joining George Brown College, he spent nearly a decade with United Way Greater Toronto. He also held similar leadership positions at the Anglican Church of Canada, the YMCA of Greater Toronto, and the National Ballet of Canada. Prior to these roles, Michael was a manager at EY, and as an independent consultant, he supported arts and heritage organizations through the development and delivery of financial and governance training to a variety of organizations throughout Ontario.

Michael's community involvement includes past governance roles with organizations such as Social Planning Council, Toronto Foundation, and Ontario Museums Association. He currently serves on the board of directors for the Toronto Arts Council, Toronto Arts Foundation, and Making The Shift - a Youth Homelessness Social Innovation Lab.

Michael holds a Bachelor of Commerce from the University of Toronto and has been a member of the Chartered Professional Accountants of Ontario since 1996.
